<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>A one-act play.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Neal and Max in the fall: What a pleasure it is to live in the Northeast and watch the seasons change.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jamie, in her LA home: I know, I miss New York.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Neal and Max yesterday: It is so cold we now understand <em>The Revenant</em>’s horse sleeping bag scene.</p>

<span><strong style="color:#000">Politics: </strong></span><span>In a speech in Atlanta yesterday, President Biden advocated for </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/voting-rights-joe-biden-georgia-voting-martin-luther-king-jr-dc4544c23622f35fc95d63afe512554d?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweaking Senate rules</a></span><span> in order to pass voting rights laws. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/11/who-warns-against-treating-covid-omicron-like-flu?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
The Showdown Over Covid's Endgame
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/11/who-warns-against-treating-covid-omicron-like-flu?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="A mural of two people with face masks facing each other adorns a wall in Madrid" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/adacda3c01ec897f5ec3afefad337deb4211a0fc-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Carlos Alvarez/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The debate is heating up over which prefix we should attach to -demic to describe Covid. And how officials answer that question could profoundly shape government policies, as well as the course of the virus itself.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How the debate began: </strong>Earlier this week, Spain’s prime minister became the first European leader to argue that it may be time for the EU to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-11/omicron-has-spain-looking-past-pandemic-as-europe-surge-persists?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approach Covid</a> the same way it approaches the seasonal flu—that is, by scrapping quarantines and case counts and instead relying on a “sentinel surveillance” system that aims to protect vulnerable populations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The justification? Omicron appears to be less severe than prior strains of the virus and has sent fewer Europeans to the hospital than in previous waves. And while vaccinations don’t prevent people from getting infected, they have been shown to protect against severe illness.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Quick refresher on pandemic vs. endemic:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Pandemic: </strong></span><span>When a disease’s growth is exponential and spreads across countries.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Endemic: </strong></span><span>A disease that’s always present, but spreads at a predictable rate.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other European countries where there’s been increased political opposition to Covid restrictions are also embracing the “e” word. The UK, for one, is “on a path towards transitioning from pandemic to endemic,” its health minister said Sunday.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The WHO enters the chat</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The health organization said yesterday that talk of Covid becoming endemic is like already crowning the Packers as the Super Bowl champions. It described a “<a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-59948920?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">west-to-east tidal wave</a>” of Omicron that’s projected to infect more than 50% of Europe’s population in the next six-to-eight weeks.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>With a “huge amount of uncertainty and a virus that is evolving quite quickly…we are certainly not at the point where we are able to call it endemic," the WHO's senior emergency officer for Europe, Catherine Smallwood, </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/who-warns-against-treating-covid-19-like-flu-2022-01-11/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span>.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Another WHO official added that Omicron was still life-threatening to older folks, people with underlying health conditions, and the unvaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Meanwhile, in the US…</strong>Covid hospitalizations hit a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-breaks-covid-19-hospitalization-record-omicron-surges-2022-01-10/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record high</a> on Monday, topping the peak from last January. The number of patients requiring intensive care, however, is considerably lower than last year’s record.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/bank-of-america-cut-overdraft-fee?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Banks Are Over the Overdraft
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/bank-of-america-cut-overdraft-fee?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="A person lounges in a debit card hammock, between two stacks of coins." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/740838fc5433960923a4eb54a204a35449250acc-1500x1000.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Photo Illustration: Dianna "Mick" McDougall; Sources: Getty Images, Bank of America</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Someone must’ve been visited by three ghosts in the night, because Bank of America decided to make life a little less difficult for account holders without piles of cash. The bank—America’s second largest—announced on Tuesday that it would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/bank-of-america-to-reduce-overdraft-fees-to-10-11641912259?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reduce overdraft fees</a> by around 70%, from $35 to $10.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BofA is also scrapping a $12 non-sufficient funds fee (for bouncing a check or making an automated overdraft) and will eliminate transfer fees for its overdraft protection service.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The decision comes on the recently shined heels of similar moves by other large banks.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Capital One announced last month that it was eliminating overdraft fees altogether.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In August, JPMorgan increased its charge-incurring overdraft amount to $50 (it was previously $5).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>PNC Bank introduced a 24-hour grace period on overdraft penalties.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether this is an example of healthy competition among industry players, or simply banks getting ahead of regulation by an increasingly scrutinous Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), is for the banks and Mr. Monopoly to know.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Although hated by account holders, overdraft fees have been a significant revenue source for banks. According to the CFPB, major banks make about $15.5 billion per year on these charges. 80% of that amount comes from 9% of customers who get dinged repeatedly.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CURRENCY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/maya-angelou-sally-ride-historical-women-US-quarters?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
The Quarter’s History Gets a New Stanza
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/maya-angelou-sally-ride-historical-women-US-quarters?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="The Maya Angelou quarter" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b5180656b1826a746c9d0bee3048d09235746727-1600x1200.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>US Mint</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maya Angelou just became the first Black woman to grace the quarter. The new coin, which the US Mint started shipping Monday, <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90712092/u-s-quarters-get-a-dramatic-redesign-with-maya-angelou-and-other-notable-women?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=webfeeds" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">features the poet</a> on its tails side shadowed by a flying bird—a nod to her famous autobiography, <em>I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Angelou’s is the first of 20 quarter designs that will be issued over the next four years and give some much-deserved monetary facetime to women. This year, four more of those women will make their way to your 7-Eleven’s cash register:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sally Ride, the first female astronaut</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Wilma Mankiller, the first female principal chief of the Cherokee Nation</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nina Otero-Warren, a New Mexican suffragist and politician</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Anna May Wong, a Chinese American actress</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They’ll join the <a href="https://www.artandobject.com/news/maya-angelou-sally-ride-join-few-women-us-currency?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tiny list</a> of women who have been featured on US currency. Only one, the golden dollar coin featuring Sacagawea, was actively in circulation before this rollout.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fun fact: </strong>The “heads” side of these new quarters will still have George Washington’s profile on them…but a version created by American woman sculptor Laura Gardin Fraser that was passed over for John Flanagan’s design in 1932.—<em>JW</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/11/key-performance-indicators-january-12?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Americans read an average of <a href="https://news.gallup.com/poll/388541/americans-reading-fewer-books-past.aspx?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">12.6 books</a> in the past year, according to a Gallup survey. That’s fewer books than in any previous survey dating back to 1990, and two or three fewer books per year than in every year from 2001–2016. This makes us feel better.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“In the (near) future, every person will have a parallel digital identity. Avatars, crypto wallets, digital goods will be the norm. Are you planning for this?”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Reese Witherspoon is all packed and ready for a solo self-discovery hike through the metaverse. But her <a href="https://twitter.com/ReeseW/status/1480953798013054976?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">polarizing prediction</a> shouldn’t come as a surprise: The actor and entrepreneur bought her first NFTs in October and has gone deep down the crypto rabbit hole.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> The subtle psychology and economics of taxi fares. (<a href="https://www.gsb.stanford.edu/insights/tipping-point-subtle-psychology-economics-taxi-fares?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Stanford Business</a>)</p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/11/kim-k-floyd-mayweather-sued-by-crypto-investors?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Kim K., Floyd Mayweather Sued by Crypto Investors
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/11/kim-k-floyd-mayweather-sued-by-crypto-investors?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Kim Kardashian" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2b4aebb12fbaeb54233d3bf00786da9bff3ec971-4079x2720.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>David Livingston/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In June 2021, up to 21% of all American adults saw Kim Kardashian’s Instagram post that promoted a cryptocurrency called EthereumMax. It was deemed the “financial promotion with the single biggest audience reach in history” by the UK’s top finance regulator.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But some say it was just a scam. Yesterday, a group of EthereumMax investors <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/kim-kardashian-and-floyd-mayweather-sued-over-roles-in-alleged-cryptocurrency-scam-1235073201/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued Kardashian</a>, as well as boxer Floyd Mayweather and former NBA star Paul Pierce, for allegedly pumping up the crypto’s price in order to sell their own EthereumMax tokens at a profit.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mayweather wore trunks promoting EthereumMax in a fight against Logan Paul last year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Paul Pierce tweeted last May that he had made more money on EthereumMax in a month than he had made in an entire year working at ESPN.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">EthereumMax, which has no connection to the second-largest crypto, ethereum, dropped 98% in July from its peak, the complaint says, and it hasn’t recovered.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>finance officials say to watch out for crypto scams in the year ahead. They are “by far” the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/11/crypto-scams-are-the-top-threat-to-investors-by-far-say-regulators.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top threat</a> to investors, according to a survey of North American securities regulators.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

Powell said the Fed would do what’s necessary to get inflation back to normal levels.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePolitics: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn a speech in Atlanta yesterday, President Biden advocated for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/voting-rights-joe-biden-georgia-voting-martin-luther-king-jr-dc4544c23622f35fc95d63afe512554d?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweaking Senate rules\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in order to pass voting rights laws. class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A mural of two people with face masks facing each other adorns a wall in Madrid\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/adacda3c01ec897f5ec3afefad337deb4211a0fc-1024x683.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eCarlos Alvarez/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe debate is heating up over which prefix we should attach to -demic to describe Covid. And how officials answer that question could profoundly shape government policies, as well as the course of the virus itself.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow the debate began: \u003c/strong\u003eEarlier this week, Spain’s prime minister became the first European leader to argue that it may be time for the EU to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-11/omicron-has-spain-looking-past-pandemic-as-europe-surge-persists?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproach Covid\u003c/a\u003e the same way it approaches the seasonal flu—that is, by scrapping quarantines and case counts and instead relying on a “sentinel surveillance” system that aims to protect vulnerable populations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe justification? Omicron appears to be less severe than prior strains of the virus and has sent fewer Europeans to the hospital than in previous waves. And while vaccinations don’t prevent people from getting infected, they have been shown to protect against severe illness.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQuick refresher on pandemic vs. endemic:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePandemic: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen a disease’s growth is exponential and spreads across countries.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEndemic: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA disease that’s always present, but spreads at a predictable rate.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOther European countries where there’s been increased political opposition to Covid restrictions are also embracing the “e” word. The UK, for one, is “on a path towards transitioning from pandemic to endemic,” its health minister said Sunday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe WHO enters the chat\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe health organization said yesterday that talk of Covid becoming endemic is like already crowning the Packers as the Super Bowl champions. It described a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-59948920?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewest-to-east tidal wave\u003c/a\u003e” of Omicron that’s projected to infect more than 50% of Europe’s population in the next six-to-eight weeks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWith a “huge amount of uncertainty and a virus that is evolving quite quickly…we are certainly not at the point where we are able to call it endemic,\" the WHO's senior emergency officer for Europe, Catherine Smallwood, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/who-warns-against-treating-covid-19-like-flu-2022-01-11/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnother WHO official added that Omicron was still life-threatening to older folks, people with underlying health conditions, and the unvaccinated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMeanwhile, in the US…\u003c/strong\u003eCovid hospitalizations hit a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-breaks-covid-19-hospitalization-record-omicron-surges-2022-01-10/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord high\u003c/a\u003e on Monday, topping the peak from last January. The number of patients requiring intensive care, however, is considerably lower than last year’s record.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBanks Are Over the Overdraft\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/740838fc5433960923a4eb54a204a35449250acc-1500x1000.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto Illustration: Dianna \"Mick\" McDougall; Sources: Getty Images, Bank of America\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSomeone must’ve been visited by three ghosts in the night, because Bank of America decided to make life a little less difficult for account holders without piles of cash. The bank—America’s second largest—announced on Tuesday that it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/bank-of-america-to-reduce-overdraft-fees-to-10-11641912259?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereduce overdraft fees\u003c/a\u003e by around 70%, from $35 to $10.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBofA is also scrapping a $12 non-sufficient funds fee (for bouncing a check or making an automated overdraft) and will eliminate transfer fees for its overdraft protection service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe decision comes on the recently shined heels of similar moves by other large banks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCapital One announced last month that it was eliminating overdraft fees altogether.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn August, JPMorgan increased its charge-incurring overdraft amount to $50 (it was previously $5).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePNC Bank introduced a 24-hour grace period on overdraft penalties.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhether this is an example of healthy competition among industry players, or simply banks getting ahead of regulation by an increasingly scrutinous Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), is for the banks and Mr. Monopoly to know.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Although hated by account holders, overdraft fees have been a significant revenue source for banks. According to the CFPB, major banks make about $15.5 billion per year on these charges. 80% of that amount comes from 9% of customers who get dinged repeatedly.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Mint\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaya Angelou just became the first Black woman to grace the quarter. The new coin, which the US Mint started shipping Monday, \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90712092/u-s-quarters-get-a-dramatic-redesign-with-maya-angelou-and-other-notable-women?utm_source=feedly\u0026utm_medium=webfeeds\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efeatures the poet\u003c/a\u003e on its tails side shadowed by a flying bird—a nod to her famous autobiography, \u003cem\u003eI Know Why the Caged Bird Sings\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAngelou’s is the first of 20 quarter designs that will be issued over the next four years and give some much-deserved monetary facetime to women. This year, four more of those women will make their way to your 7-Eleven’s cash register:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSally Ride, the first female astronaut\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWilma Mankiller, the first female principal chief of the Cherokee Nation\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNina Otero-Warren, a New Mexican suffragist and politician\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnna May Wong, a Chinese American actress\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey’ll join the \u003ca href=\"https://www.artandobject.com/news/maya-angelou-sally-ride-join-few-women-us-currency?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etiny list\u003c/a\u003e of women who have been featured on US currency. Only one, the golden dollar coin featuring Sacagawea, was actively in circulation before this rollout.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFun fact: \u003c/strong\u003eThe “heads” side of these new quarters will still have George Washington’s profile on them…but a version created by American woman sculptor Laura Gardin Fraser that was passed over for John Flanagan’s design in American adults saw Kim Kardashian’s Instagram post that promoted a cryptocurrency called EthereumMax. It was deemed the “financial promotion with the single biggest audience reach in history” by the UK’s top finance regulator.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut some say it was just a scam. Yesterday, a group of EthereumMax investors \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/kim-kardashian-and-floyd-mayweather-sued-over-roles-in-alleged-cryptocurrency-scam-1235073201/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esued Kardashian\u003c/a\u003e, as well as boxer Floyd Mayweather and former NBA star Paul Pierce, for allegedly pumping up the crypto’s price in order to sell their own EthereumMax tokens at a profit.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMayweather wore trunks promoting EthereumMax in a fight against Logan Paul last year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePaul Pierce tweeted last May that he had made more money on EthereumMax in a month than he had made in an entire year working at ESPN.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEthereumMax, which has no connection to the second-largest crypto, ethereum, dropped 98% in July from its peak, the complaint says, and it hasn’t recovered.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003efinance officials say to watch out for crypto scams in the year ahead.
